sentences.sentence: Gen Z is divided over politics.

What will the fallout be?Listen to and follow 'Matter of Opinion'Apple Podcasts|Spotify|Amazon MusicAround the world, the youngest cohort of voters is dividing itself politically along gendered lines.
What's behind this great gender divergence?This week on “Matter of Opinion,” the hosts debate the causes and consequences of a gender-divided world.
Plus, Ross Douthat has some timing advice, should you choose to improve the national birthrate.
(A full transcript of this episode can be found in the center of the audio player above.

)Mentioned in this episode:·“A New Global Gender Divide Is Emerging,” by John Burn-Murdoch in The Financial Times·“Taylor Swift, Donald Trump and the Right's Abnormality Problem,” by Ross Douthat in The Times“A New Global Gender Divide Is Emerging,” by John Burn-Murdoch in The Financial Times“Taylor Swift, Donald Trump and the Right's Abnormality Problem,” by Ross Douthat in The TimesThoughts?

Email us atmatterofopinion@nytimes.com.Follow our hosts on X: Michelle Cottle (@mcottle), Ross Douthat (@DouthatNYT) and Carlos Lozada (@CarlosNYT).“Matter of Opinion” is produced by Phoebe Lett, Sophia Alvarez Boyd and Derek Arthur.
It is edited by Alison Bruzek and Jordana Hochman.
Original music by Isaac Jones, Efim Shapiro, Carole Sabouraud, Sonia Herrero and Pat McCusker.
Our fact-checking team is Kate Sinclair, Mary Marge Locker and Michelle Harris.
Audience strategy by Shannon Busta and Kristina Samulewski.
Our executive producer is Annie-Rose Strasser.PHOTO: (PHOTOGRAPH BY Illustration by The New York Times; Photograph by Keiko Iwabuchi/Getty Images FOR THE NEW YORK TIMES)

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
